comment:
Excellent, excellent bourbon, as to be expected for the price. Bought this for a special occasion. 
Nose: Mild smoke smell, caramel, honey. Entry: Brown sugar, spice lots of honey, under tones almond, notes of vanilla. Mid-palate brings more of the same, with a hint of smoke arising. Finish: Long and lingering honey flavor, with mild hints of barrel smoke.
Overall, this is an incredibly sophisticated whiskey that's amazingly smooth yet very complex.
Smooth flavor with an almost mouth wash clean finish in the mouth. A little water and the other flavor a really open up to a complex tastes worthy of the price.
I tried this and felt that it was a little too smooth and mild for a Wild Turkey product. Nice flavor but lacking the spicy kick that one expects from this brand. Not worth the price.
Very strong, smoky, little bit fruity
Had a 1 oz taste of this and it was delish! Wasn't sure I wanted to spent that much money but it definitely is worth the price.

So smooth you wouldn't even know it comes from Wild Turkey. Maybe a little thin and short, but it's got that signature WT flavor profile -- and plenty of it.  Very tasty.  Pairs well with bleu cheese and apricots.
Je ne sais pas si ces parce que j'ai acheté cette bouteille dans le temps de Noël mais je trouve qu'il à un gout de ''candy cane'' en fin de bouche. À essayer pour sur!
A very nice taste with fruit undertones and some smokiness to it. A nice amount of spiciness makes this a complex bourbon and gives it a classic wild turkey profile.

Argh! I finally have a bottle. But i got handed it by jimmy russell himself. Should i drink it? Wwjd? Drink it. This is a damn masterpiece, the russell family are geniuses, anyone who dismisses wt is a fool.
Probably the best bourbon I've ever tasted, but flavor varies a lot by the bottle. Mine is extremely smooth, my brother's has the signature Turkey bite.
Opens up nicely with a small splash of water and some time in the glass. Jimmy Russell, don't ever leave us.
I just drank this bottle... It's a smokey citrus gift to human kind with a mild sweetness to it. I would never say a bourbon tastes like pound cake.
A very smooth bourbon which you should expect at the price tag. One of the best my top three bourbons I've ever had. Il
Not very spicy, smooth. Not worth the price.
Amazing nose. Rickhouse, like Stagg Jr once you've emptied the glass. Not overstated. Soft and refined palate. Classic bourbon taste profile, vanilla, caramel, etc. Not much of a finish.
Tried this for the $10 dram Friday. While it was very smooth, I prefer other, cheaper scotches that I've tried.
I bought my bottle in t and was waiting for a special occasion to open it and sip.  the flavor that I noticed the most was a very buttery toffee.more so than any other bourbon I've ever tasted.
Solid but not worth the $ IMO

Color is more mahogany, expected a richer color for the age. The nose is mild, I get sweet vanilla and caramel with a nice wood/corn under tone. The palette is just as mild and sweet as the nose with hints of wood and chocolate. The finish is long warm and peppery. Very smooth sipper and a great pour. 

Martin's $125

Batch No. B14-0035. Great nose. Caramel, butterscotch, a floral note. Smooth, but also thin, on the tongue. Decent sweetness, vanilla and wood notes. Some bitterness on the end. Perhaps not the familiar Wild Turkey punch, but pleasant sipper. 7/7/17
This has opened up. It's still thinner than other WT bottles but it's fuller than last time. Much more caramel and vanilla this time around. The spice is balancing. Bumping this up a star. 7/30/17 peanut notes have really developed as I get to the end of the bottle. Very flavorful for this proof. Will definitely pick up another bottle if I can find it for under $100. 10/20/17
Very smooth. Rich flavors. Excellent taste

This is a great bourbon. There's an amazing complexity and richness that solidifies with each sip. The nose is ripe with caramel and toasted nuts. The beautiful color is inviting and holds a pleasant sweetness accompanied by warmth rather than raw heat. This is smooth, enjoyable and easy (almost to a fault) to drink. The aging is evident and found myself intrigued by the flavor profile without opening it up with a drop of water. This is a true savorer's bourbon. The only downside is this one? A bit overpriced and out of reach for some. That's a pity because if you're a bourbon fan, you should try this. I myself would love another dram, but it's too rare and expensive to make an appearance in my collection. (FWF $10 Dram [1st] share #17)
grassy front with a chewy, vanilla body ending in cherry

Rainbow of flavors, and a nose that beats Parker’s 24- ..The nose is just phenomenal. 
I’d say the value is parallel to the lovely Rare Breed and Kentucky spirit ~$60-$70 value.... not $130, but oh well. I like wild turkey. 

Try this before you bye.

Impress your friends with this bourbon. There’s something magical here where the bourbon rolls through a multitude of flavors that feel deep and everlasting. Good spice and smoke with just the right touch of heat that reminds you it’s a brand of Wild Turkey. The Diamond part comes in with just the slightest touch of vanilla and sweetness. Any bourbon lover needs to have a bottle of this in his or her arsenal.
Nose - Peanut brittle, caramel, cherry, smoke and vanilla.  Taste - toasted oak, cola, chocolate, fruity,
WoW, Best Bourbon I have ever Had to Date. Sweet Spice,rich Carmel,Vanilla’s and Oak. Very well Balanced. Very well done. I wish I could buy another Bottle Locally. Outstanding!
Complex. Doesn’t disappoint from start to finish.

Very good WT product. This was a gift, lucky me! I find it not sweet but yet not hot, great overall flavor that should satisfy just about every bourbon drinker. Steep price will deter many buyers, which it should. Let’s face it, just about all bourbon is tasty, whether it’s $125 or just $25. Definitely glad  I got to try this, and so much of it too! 3.5/5

Taste:  Chilled neatly in a glen cairn glass

Nose:  (3.5)  Musty oak and barrel.  Characteristic Wild Turkey nose which pleases me.  Some vanilla but lacks some in complexity.

Palate: (4.25) The oak is upfront but gives way to an almost peanut brittle sweetness.  As it catches air it releases more flavor like cherry syrup, and rye bread.  What this lacks in complexity on the nose it makes up for on the palate.  It makes me want to study it more.

Finish: (4.5)  I love the finish.  It balances sweetness and spice and then fades gradually without heating you up.  It is a well conducted symphony on the finish.  It is like rocking out to your favorite song after you have dialed up the perfect EQ.

I am a big Wild Turkey admirer and not turned off by some of the "reputation" prejudice that the brand gets.  I will say  though that the price point is high by comparison to other Wild Turkey premiums.  I got just as much enjoyment from Russell 10 yr SiB and Rare Breed for half the bottle price.  That saying......go get you some Diamond Anniversary because now I feel a need to buy Master's Keep for a side by side comparison!
Cherry and barrel spices that just linger... finish goes on and on. The 91 proof is smooth but this bourbon is not tame...
Oaky smooth with vanilla and Carmel

Wild Turkey Diamond Anniversary
Nose- Cinnamon and pie crust. Some Krispy Kreme donuts maybe?
Body- Russian tea notes of orange,  cinnamon, and cloves. 
Finish. Sweet tea tannins here. This is a very complex bourbon where ever sip seems to give you a little something more. The current lead bourbon in our 1068 Pubcast blind taste test! It even beat out the Four Roses limited small batch 2014... barely.

Revisited this one tonight after bottle being open for awhile.  As much as it hurts I have to drop the rating a bit.  Not enough "wow" factor on the nose.  Although the palette and finish is fun and changing, it is a bit dead and misses a higher proof I think.  Finish is still pretty kick ass though.  $129 good?  Nah.  Tasty Wild Turkey with history to it-- for sure.

Nose: Vanilla and wood.
Pallet: fruit like apricot, raspberry that turns into cherry syrup.
Finish: Herbal like mint and grass.

Love this stuff! There is something new in the flavor will each sip.

Review is spot on

Peanut brittle on the nose

Def get some menthol on the palate. 

A delicate yet complex whiskey. Remarkable. Cheers!

Give it time in the glass.  Too be sipped over time.  DON'T put any drops of water like I did at first.  Take your time and it will mellow out.  Not overly sweet. More nuanced.  Dare I say more "sophisticated" bourbon?  Menthol, butterscotch, candy apples.  Getting marzipan which I assume from the higher content of barley. Hints of vanilla, leather, and nutmeg.  I assume vanilla from good casks, leather from the age, and nutmeg from the rye.  A hint of brewed tea.  All that said I really like Russells 10 year reserve because it is richer is taste and mouthfeel.  Both are good.  Both are different.

Nose: cleaner, vanilla, raspberries 
Palate: minty and peppery. Not quite as peppery as the Masters Keep Decades and a tiny bit sweeter. Minty sweet mojitos is best described. 
Finish: minty sweet mojitos and a little oak/cleaner.
If you have $125 sitting around and are lucky enough to find one of these bottles sitting around pick it up. Smokey fruit taste. Everything a bourbon should be.

Cherry syrup, caramel, peanuts, with a hint of spice.  The dram continues to open up in the glass and turns into an adult hot fudge cherry sundae. Somehow manages to have spice but go down smooth. Wish it was higher proof for $100 but very complex bourbon here
Just simply the best bourbon I’ve ever had.
Smooth! 4.65 probably w the smoothness! Thanks AC!
Rich, sweet, smooth. Almost no burn at all

this is much better than I remembered. it smells like a burbon and drinks like a rye.  alot of caramel up front but alot of spice.   the finish is fantastic.  lasts and lasts.  very strong but still goes down easily.  it's not something that i'd drink regularly.  it's alot.  but at the end of a long week, it's just the ticket.

Brilliant, copper colored spirit, medium depth of color, long, lingering legs. 

Nose is intense, with heavy notes of caramel and vanilla with light hints of oak. 

Palate is sweet caramel and vanilla up front, followed by oak and a medium-long, spicy finish
This is still one of the best bourbons I’ve ever had. Smokey, fruity, nutty. It is just a smooth all around bourbon.

Nose has vanilla, barrel char, apple fruitiness, and spice.

The palate is deep and earthy with black pepper and spice with a bit of vanilla and caramel.  I get char and a bitter taste like the bitter in dark chocolate, but only the bitter notes.

There is a lot of char in the finish and a healthy dose of spice (maybe orange and cloves?) There is a dry, astringent, smokiness.

Nose is very sugary and vanilla at first. Then fruit and floral notes as it sits. The palette has a lot of spice and heat and feels like it is higher proof than listed on the bottle.

Edit: This has been open for awhile. Coming back to it this evening the fruit is more present on the nose. On the taste the barrel is very present with some bitter and woody notes. A little hint of spice follows that becomes warmth as it finishes.

Would purchase again.
so smooth, very deep and broad in flavor. notes of caramel, stone fruit, licorice, maple, and spice. exceptional.

My favorite watering hole has been knocking it out of the park recently with rare Bourbon at a reasonable price! This is the latest example! 
My main takeaway is just how velvety it feels in your mouth. Very coating and viscous at 91 proof. Impressive! On the pallette it leads with vanilla and sweet tea and then quickly transitions to spice notes. Mid palatte features dried fruit notes (apricots) and leads into a long oak and tobacco driven finish. Some old leather too. Wonderful! 
Why not 5 stars you ask? Simple, while it's very good, it's not the best rare Bourbon I have had. 4-4.5/5. Definitely worth a pour or bottle if you can find it.

Nose - black tea, cherry, apple, chalky caramel, spiced vanilla, bubble gum, dry peanut must (similar to the Beam funk, but not quite as funky), horehound, mild licorice, sweet subtle oak, light cinnamon, mild ethanol burn. 

Taste - black tea, cherry, grape, strong (but not bitter) oak notes, peanuts, licorice, black pepper, slight rye spice, caramel, sweet tobacco, dry spiced vanilla, almost nonexistent alcohol bite, finishing long and mellow with lingering, sweet and mildly tannic earthy tea flavors. 

I rarely get tea flavors with bourbon, and never this strongly before. While I generally like higher proofs bourbons better, I disagree with some of the other reviewers who indicated this would be better at a higher proof. It is wonderfully mellow; all the harsh edges have been rounded off by time. Reminds me of lounging on a big front porch on a hot summer day drinking sweet iced tea. There are bourbons whose flavor profiles I like better, but this feels perfectly balanced and masterfully engineered. However, for my money I’d rather have two bottles of ECBP.

I won’t lie, I liked it of course but it was not in my top 5 WT elites. For my taste this only competes with some of their midrange expressions but with a heftier fee. The nose was dry with aromas of floral, aged oak and char. The palette was similar with oak leading the show. This was best as a neat pour as water/ice muddied the waters too much. I don’t regret the purchase, it was enjoyed, but I would not repeat unless 20-30 less in price.

향 : 배경에 은은히 깔린 스모키함, 화사한 허브, 향으로도 느껴지는 견과류의 오일리함, 연필깎은 향, 스무스함

맛 : 혀끝에 빠르고 강한 스파이시, 새 오크, 맵다!!, 신선한 고무(?), 설탕보단 과일맛에 가까운 버번류, 플로랄, 태운 페퍼민트, 많이 탄 설탕, 쌉쌀함, 가죽맛

피니쉬 : 오일리함, 나무, 화함, 잔 향기와 은은한 스파이시가 지속됨, 입안에 아주 작은 새 오크통을 몇번 씹은 후 느낌(쌉쌀함),
Very smooth. Not a lot of typical WT profile for me but a delicate bourbon. Very enjoyable
Velvety smooth.  Very very nice.  Carmel vanilla.
